meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a buffoon.
meanings.sent1: The clown's buffoonish outfit made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: His buffoonish behavior at the party embarrassed his friends.
meanings.sent3: The buffoonish antics of the puppy chasing its tail entertained the children.
meanings.sent4: Her buffoonish attempts at juggling plates ended in a disaster.
meanings.sent5: The buffoonish character in the play wore oversized shoes and a red nose.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a silly or ridiculous manner.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's buffoonish jokes had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent2: She made a buffoonish face to cheer up her friend.
meanings.sent3: His buffoonish dance moves always brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The buffoonish gestures of the mime were both amusing and entertaining.
meanings.sent5: The buffoonish attempts to fix the broken toy only made it worse.
